pr_title: [JENKINS-28379] Allow FingerprintFacet to block the deletion of Fingerprint

timeline.bodyText: Will the tools that discover getters and setters (like Pipeline, Configuration as Code, etc.) recognize the prefix "block" and the prefix "unblock" as setters?  Are any of them ever expected to need to discover these?
timeline.author: MarkEWaite

replies.bodyText: IIUC, the plugins do need to be able to discover these setters (since they are the ones that create the facets), and would want to block the deletion of the facet.
replies.author: stellargo

replies.bodyText: I'm with Mark here, better to use well-known names for setters and getter
replies.author: MRamonLeon

replies.bodyText: Hi, I had misunderstood. I am happy to convert it to the Jenkins standards. It would be really helpful if you could point me to a code snippet which uses these standards.
replies.author: stellargo

replies.bodyText:
It would be a way to go (standard Java setter implemetation)
    public void setFingerprintDeletionBlocked(boolean value) {
replies.author: oleg-nenashev

timeline.author: oleg-nenashev

timeline.bodyText: Might be great to add some logging later, but the current chance follows the convention
timeline.author: oleg-nenashev

replies.bodyText: Thanks @oleg-nenashev , I added logging, let me know if it is fine.
replies.author: stellargo

timeline.message: [JENKINS-28379] Allow FingerprintFacet to block the deletion of Fingerprint

timeline.bodyText: Would be great to reference the facet blocking it
timeline.author: oleg-nenashev

replies.bodyText: A facet by default IIUC only has timestamp and fingerprint attached with it. How would I reference the facet? Should I do it by timestamp? Or should i write a toString method for the facet class?
replies.author: stellargo

replies.bodyText: What about just printing a className? It would at least give the user some idea which facet blocks it
replies.author: oleg-nenashev

replies.bodyText: @oleg-nenashev Done, I also added the timestamp of creation. Let me know if anything more is required
replies.author: stellargo
